quest.name: Waiting in the Depths
journal: Thancred casts his gaze across the waterless expanse before you.
objectives: Search for anything unusual on the Norvrandt Slope.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Bismarck must be powerful indeed to create a dome of this size. I can only pray to whichever gods are listening that it continues to hold...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I remember being impressed by the domes of the Ruby Sea, but this makes them look like bubbles in a stream!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Come, let us begin our search.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This is amazing. I can't even see the surface!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I daresay Urianger endured much “playful” attention from the pixies to learn the lore of Bismarck. He is nothing if not a dedicated scholar.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now, as for where we should be looking, I rather doubt Emet-Selch will be sitting around out in the open.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I propose we follow the slope down towards the deeper trenches, and keep an eye out for rock formations large enough to house a stronghold.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let's be off, then─but watch your footing. The ground is still wet, and like to be slippery.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I think Thancred has the right idea, but I can't help wondering what Emet-Selch would be doing down here without the aid of gills and fins.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hm. This outcrop seemeth natural enough...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The ocean floor is a strange place to be, of course, but this aether...'tis like naught I've ever seen.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Naught out of the ordinary here...as far as I can tell.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What about that large formation over there...?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The gloom down here is so suffocating compared to that endless night sky we saw... But I suppose Emet-Selch had nowhere else to go.

dialogue.name: MANOFONDO03648
dialogue.text: <gasp>

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Finless ones...here...?

dialogue.name: MANOFONDO03648
dialogue.text: ...The finless ones! They followed me!

dialogue.name: MANOFONDO03648
dialogue.text: Why have you come! Was it you who took away our water!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, so this is where the Ondo make their home. I had wondered...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray forgive us any inconvenience we have caused─we were not aware your people lived here in the Tempest.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We need this great dome of air that we might conduct a most urgent search, and thus beg you for your understanding...

dialogue.name: MANOFONDO03648
dialogue.text: Chieftain, what are we to do...?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: ...Are you emissaries of the ancient ones?

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: The mysteries have ssstirred. We have ssseen the illuminated land shhhining through the gloom of the abyss...

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: If you are the emissaries─the chosen─I bid you welcome. If you are not, I bid you leave.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am...not sure I understand. Would you be willing to elaborate...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...It would seem not. I suggest we withdraw for the moment.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So, what's the plan? Given your “condition,” I'm reluctant to suggest lingering here.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That said, our presently meandering search would proceed far more swiftly if we could call upon the Ondo's local knowledge.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes, I'd like to know more about this “illuminated land” the chieftain spoke of.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Could it be Emet-Selch's stronghold, do you suppose? Perhaps he...lit the lanterns upon his return?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We cannot dismiss the possibility, but if these Ondo refuse to speak with us...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename─do you remember my first scheme for entering Eulmore? How I had planned to ingratiate myself by offering lucrative trading opportunities with the Ondo?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The individual I dealt with was reticent in manner and curious in custom, but we were able to reach an agreement, nonetheless.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I believe that with the right approach, we can build a similar relationship here.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What kind of approach did you have in mind? That chieftain fellow didn't leave us many options.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If we are to tread the swiftest course, then we must needs locate its beginning. 'Tis plain our all too dramatic arrival hath thrown this settlement into confusion...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Were we to solve such problems as we have caused, and assure our hosts thereby that our purpose here is not inimical to them, they may yet prove amenable to reason.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...I smell chores. But very well─if it can be done quickly.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What do you think? I've nothing better to offer, but I do worry what will happen if the Ondo's tales end up leading us to a dead end.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I cannot say for certain, but I sense this tribe has a deeper connection to the Ascians than first meets the eye.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It warrants further investigation. Thus I cast my vote in favor of aiding the settlement for the time being.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We will make allies of the Ondo!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let's do what we do best!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll do what I can, I suppose...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then it is settled. Y'shtola─pray proceed with your investigations. The rest of us will see about fostering some goodwill!

dialogue.name: TOLSHSAATH
dialogue.text: Was it fate that brought you to usss...?

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: You are Alphinaud's friend...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename! You won't believe who I've just bumped into!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is Paushs Ooan, the very fellow I did business with prior to our ill-fated stay in Eulmore!

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: I waited, and you did not come. Then the Myssstel came, but his visits did not continue...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am truly sorry, Paushs Ooan─things did not proceed as planned. Is there aught we can do for you by way of an apology?

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Perhapsss... “Where the Dry Return,” a cavern to the north, is home to giant crabs. We do not fear the crab, for we are the swifter ssswimmers.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: But now there is no water. We run, and they ssscuttle close behind, snipping and sssnapping with their claws. There are too many of them. Too many...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, I believe I can be of assistance there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And what of you, Forename? If you've not found a task, you are most welcome to join me. Indeed, I should appreciate the company. “Where the Dry Return” has a rather ominous ring to it...

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: Where the Dry Return is filled with crimson coral. We imagine its branches to be the veins of finless ones─the cave a resting place for those who perishhhed at sssea.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ah, as I suspected...

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: You could crack their shells? You must be ssstronger than you look...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see you've reached your quota first again. I shall never be your equal in such tasks...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Still, I would say we have reduced the local crab population to a far less threatening number.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: My thanks─to both of you. You mussst have a reward...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nay, Paushs Ooan, this was to be a part of my apology to you, remember? Besides which, the lack of water is our doing, for which we must also make amends.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Might I convince you to tell us something about your village, instead? I would very much like to learn more of you and your people.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: ...Very well. Before the Flood came, it is said that our ancestral home was found in the seas to the sssouth. It was utterly destroyed by the Light.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: Only those who were out hunting sssurvived. They swam, aimless and lossst, until they spied buildings here on the ocean floor.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: Strange buildings they were, and long had they ssstood under the water. Yet somehow they had been ssspared the scars of time and current...

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: These ssstructures provided shelter for my people─protection from the Tempest's turbulent waters and the predators which hunted within them. Their very existence ssseemed a miracle.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: The first sssettlers pondered their good fortune. It was clear that the race who had built sssuch wonders had guided their course. And from this did they discern the truth...

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: ...That the ancients had chosen us to ssserve as caretakers of their eternal sssanctuary, until sssuch time as they returned.

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: Thus, if it is judged that your coming─and this great vanishing of water─was by the ancients' design, you will find warm welcome here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A truly astonishing history. Yet I cannot help but wonder, how will the significance─or otherwise─of our arrival be decided?

dialogue.name: PAUSHSOOAN
dialogue.text: The ancients have blessed us with protection and prosperity. If your presence serves to bring us the sssame, there will be no doubt in the matter.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Then it would seem our earlier decision was the correct one.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We thank you for the lesson, Paushs Ooan, and will continue to do all we can to assist your people. Should you desire our help with any other trouble, pray do not hesitate to ask.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We should return to the task at hand. Only...do try not to overexert yourself, my friend. The risk far outweighs the gain.
